poem:
**Crossroads of Democracy**

In the morning light,  
Biden stumbles,  
words scatter  
like wind-blown leaves —  
the nation's breath held,  
echoes  
of doubt and decision.  
Which path beckons  
when the future falters,  
when voices waver  
in the democracy's haze?  
A field of choices,  
each step, a new  
promise,  
each fall, a history.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "If Biden drops out now, how do the Democrats choose a new candidate? Joe Biden is reportedly weighing whether to withdraw from the presidential race following his damaging debate performance last week, in which he repeatedly tripped over his own words and failed to rebut Donald Trump’s many false claims. According to the New York Times, Biden told a key ally that he knows his upcoming interview with George Stephanopoulos of ABC News and campaign". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
